page.title: 08TOURISM IN SOUTHSEA
page.content: People started to come to Southsea for holidays about 100 years ago and still enjoy the sea and beach today. Other main attractions are {The Mary {Rose,HMS Victory, Southsea Castle and {the D-Day museum. { }Most visitors are day trippers but some stay longer, mainly in hotels and Bed and Breakfast accommodation. Most tourists are British with an increasing number of visitors coming from Europe and America. Portsmouth is becoming more popular because of the emphasis on maritime history with the naval base being developed to include examples of our maritime heritage. A leisure complex is to be built soon as well as a sea life centre and a new camping site.
